sentences.en: Flights for Rome depart from Terminal 3.
sentences.cn: 飞往罗马的班机从3号航站楼出发。

sentences.en: He had been sent to Rome by his employer.
He had boarded an express for Rome.
sentences.cn: 他已经登上了前往罗马的特快列车。

sentences.en: He passed one night in Rome.
He spends his time flitting between Florence, Rome and Bologna.
sentences.cn: 他辗转于佛罗伦萨、罗马和博洛尼亚三地之间。
他统治着整个罗马帝国。

sentences.en: He was briefly arrested in Rome after a contretemps with Italian police.
sentences.cn: 他曾因和意大利警方发生争执而在罗马被短暂拘留。

sentences.en: In 1973, when he lived in Rome, his sixteen-year-old son was kidnapped.
sentences.cn: 1973年他在罗马居住时，他16岁的儿子遭到了绑架。

sentences.en: In the heat of Rome, the wait was agonizing.
sentences.cn: 在罗马的高温下，等待是一种折磨。

sentences.en: London was more to his liking than Rome.
sentences.cn: 伦敦比罗马更称他的心。

sentences.en: No sooner had he arrived in Rome than he was kidnapped.
sentences.cn: 他刚到罗马就遭到了绑架。

sentences.en: Rome annexed the Nabatean kingdom in 106 AD.
sentences.cn: 公元106年罗马吞并了纳巴泰王国。

sentences.en: The cult of Isis was carried from Egypt into Greece and Rome.
sentences.cn: 对伊希斯的膜拜从埃及传到了希腊和罗马。

sentences.en: The statue was brought to Rome in antiquity .
sentences.cn: 这座雕像是古时运到罗马的。

sentences.en: The thermometer nudged three figures yesterday in Rome.
sentences.cn: 罗马昨天气温接近（华氏）三位数。

sentences.en: They believed ancient Greece and Rome were vital sources of learning.
sentences.cn: 他们认为古代希腊罗马是知识的重要发源地。

phrases.tran_cn: (谚)条条大路通罗马；殊途同归

phrases.phrase: Rome was not built in a day
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)罗马城不是一天建成的；伟业非一日可成

phrases.phrase: when in Rome (do as the Romans do)

trans.tran_cn: 罗马（意大利首都），罗马不是一天建成的，伟业非一日之功，入乡随俗
